div.p:
Published by:
U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor when conforming to the US-Core IG. The statement includes the complete list of actual profiles, RESTful operations, search parameters supported by US Core Servers. US Core Requesters have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

The US Core Server SHALL support the <a href=StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html">US Core patient resource profile. In addition to the US Core patient, the US Core Server SHALL support at least one additional resource profile from the list of US-Core profiles. The US Core Server SHALL implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification. The US Core Server SHALL support json, and SHOULD support xml resource formats for all US Core interactions. The US Core Server SHALL identify the US Core profile(s) supported as part of the FHIR BaseResource.Meta.profile attribute for each instance. The US Core Server SHALL declare a Capability statement and identify the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.
US Core Servers SHALL meet the security requirements documented in the US-Core Security requirements..

div.p: US Core Servers SHALL support the following common parameters as part of queries related to US-Core profiles:
US Core Servers SHALL support the following search contexts defined within the FHIRspecification.

ul.li: Search context by specifying a particular resource type

div.p: US Core Servers SHALL support Modifiers as applicable to the data types of the search parameters. US Core Servers SHALL also support Composite Search Parameters as defined in the FHIR specification.

ul.li: id="US Core id - Search based on resource id ( string)
identifier - Search based on patient identifier ( token)
name and gender- Search based on given name or family name or text name and gender.
family and gender- Search based on family name and gender.
given and gender- Search based on given name and gender.
name and birthdate- Search based on given name or family name or text name and birthdate.
patient - Search allergies for a patient( reference)
patient and category - Search for CarePlan by patient and category
patient and category and status - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and status
patient and category and date - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and status and date - Search for CarePlan by patient and category and status and one or more dates
patient and category and status - Search for CareTeam by patient and category and status
patient and category - Search for Condition by patient and category
patient and clinicalstatus - Search for Condition by patient and clinicalstatus
patient - Search Devices for a patient( reference)
patient and date - Search for Medications by patient and one or more dates
patient - Search for Immunizations by patient (reference)
patient and code - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and code
patient and category - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and code and date - Search for DiagnosticReport by patient and category and code and one or more dates
patient and code - Search for Observation by patient and code
patient and category - Search for Observation by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for Observation by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and category and code and date - Search for Observation by patient and category and code and one or more dates
None
None
patient - Search MedicationStatement for a patient( reference)
patient - Search MedicationRequest for a patient( reference)
patient and code - Search for Observation (SmokingStatus) by patient and code
patient and code - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and code
patient and category - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and category
patient and category and date - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and category and one or more dates
patient and code and date - Search for Observation (Vital Signs) by patient and code and one or more dates
None
None
patient and date - Search for Procedure by patient and date

publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor when conforming to the US-Core IG.

documentation.value: The US Core Server SHALL support the US Core patient resource profile. In addition to the US Core patient, the US Core Server SHALL support at least one additional resource profile from the list of US Core profiles. The US Core Server SHALL implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification. The US Core Server SHALL support both json and xml resource formats for all US Core interactions.

description.value: US Core Servers SHALL implement the security requirements documented in the US-Core IG.

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a [Medication] resource. If the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria **SHALL** be supported.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows discovery of existing US Core Medication resources using different search criteria.
IF the Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest. Allows retrieval of a specific US Core Medication by id
Allows review of changes to US Core Medication instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core Medication instance

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a [Medication] resource. * When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be [contained] or an external resource. * The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but if the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the [include] parameter for searching this element. * The client application must support both methods.
[include]: http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/search.html#include [contained]: http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/references.html#contained [Medication]:http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/medication.html
Allows discovery of existing US Core medicationstatement resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core medicationstatement by id
Allows review of changes to US Core medicationstatement instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core medicationstatement instance

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using either a code or refer to a [Medication] resource. * When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be [contained] or an external resource. * The server application can choose any one way or more than one method, but if the an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the [include] parameter for searching this element. * The client application must support both methods.
[include]: http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/search.html#include [contained]: http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/references.html#contained [Medication]:http://hl7.org/fhir/2017Jan/medication.html
